metadata.Title: CVE-2010-3394 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The (1) texmacs and (2) tm_mupad_help scripts in TeXmacs 1.0.7.4 place a zero-length directory name in the LD_LIBRARY_PATH, which allows local users to gain privileges via a Trojan horse shared library in the current working directory.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2010-3394` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

texmacs - 1:1.0.7.18-1
texmacs-common - 1:1.0.7.18-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: texmacs package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:1.0.7.18-1').
